name: Ext.dd.DragDropManager
doc: DragDropManager is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for all DragDrop items in the window. Generally, you will not call this class directly, but it does have helper methods that could be useful in your DragDrop implementations.

members.name: INTERSECT
members.doc: In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the overlap of two or more drag and drop objects.
members.short_doc:
In intersect mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the
overlap of two or more drag and drop objects. ...

members.name: POINT
members.doc: In point mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the location of the cursor during the drag/drop
members.short_doc:
In point mode, drag and drop interaction is defined by the
location of the cursor during the drag/drop ...

members.name: clickPixelThresh
members.doc: The number of pixels that the mouse needs to move after the mousedown before the drag is initiated. Default=8; defaults to the same value used in the LongPress gesture so that drag cannot be initiated if there is a possible pending longpress
members.short_doc:
The number of pixels that the mouse needs to move after the
mousedown before the drag is initiated. ...

members.name: clickTimeout
members.doc: Timeout used for the click time threshold

members.name: deltaX
members.doc: the X distance between the cursor and the object being dragged
members.short_doc: the X distance between the cursor and the object being dragged ...

members.name: deltaY
members.doc: the Y distance between the cursor and the object being dragged
members.short_doc: the Y distance between the cursor and the object being dragged ...

members.name: dragCls
members.doc: Class to add to the dragged element of a DragDrop instance.
members.short_doc: Class to add to the dragged element of a DragDrop instance. ...

members.name: dragCurrent
members.doc: the DragDrop object that is currently being dragged

members.name: dragOvers
members.doc: the DragDrop object(s) that are being hovered over
members.short_doc: the DragDrop object(s) that are being hovered over ...

members.name: dragThreshMet
members.doc: Flag that indicates that either the drag pixel threshold or the mousdown time threshold has been met
members.short_doc:
Flag that indicates that either the drag pixel threshold or the
mousdown time threshold has been met ...

members.name: elementCache
members.doc: A cache of DOM elements
members.short_doc: A cache of DOM elements ...

members.name: handleIds
members.doc: Array of element ids defined as drag handles. Used to determine if the element that generated the mousedown event is actually the handle and not the html element itself.
members.short_doc: Array of element ids defined as drag handles. ...

members.name: ids
members.doc: Two dimensional Array of registered DragDrop objects. The first dimension is the DragDrop item group, the second the DragDrop object.
members.short_doc: Two dimensional Array of registered DragDrop objects. ...

members.name: initialized
members.doc: Internal flag that is set to true when drag and drop has been intialized
members.short_doc:
Internal flag that is set to true when drag and drop has been
intialized ...

members.name: locationCache
members.doc: Location cache that is set for all drag drop objects when a drag is initiated, cleared when the drag is finished.
members.short_doc:
Location cache that is set for all drag drop objects when a drag is
initiated, cleared when the drag is finished. ...

members.name: locked
members.doc: All drag and drop can be disabled.
members.short_doc: All drag and drop can be disabled. ...

members.name: mode
members.doc: The current drag and drop mode. Default: POINT
members.short_doc: The current drag and drop mode. ...

members.name: notifyOccluded
members.doc:
This config is only provided to provide old, usually unwanted drag/drop behaviour.

From ExtJS 4.1.0 onwards, when drop targets are contained in floating, absolutely positioned elements such as in Windows, which may overlap each other, over and drop events are only delivered to the topmost drop target at the mouse position.

If all targets below that in zIndex order should also receive notifications, set notifyOccluded to true.
members.short_doc: This config is only provided to provide old, usually unwanted drag/drop behaviour. ...

members.name: preventDefault
members.doc: Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the events we define. By default this is true, but this can be set to false if you need the default behavior (not recommended)
members.short_doc:
Flag to determine if we should prevent the default behavior of the
events we define. ...

members.name: startX
members.doc: The X position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a drag threshold is met.
members.short_doc:
The X position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a
drag threshold is met. ...

members.name: startY
members.doc: The Y position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a drag threshold is met.
members.short_doc:
The Y position of the mousedown event stored for later use when a
drag threshold is met. ...

members.name: stopPropagation
members.doc: Flag to determine if we should stop the propagation of the events we generate. This is true by default but you may want to set it to false if the html element contains other features that require the mouse click.
members.short_doc:
Flag to determine if we should stop the propagation of the events
we generate. ...

members.name: useCache
members.doc: Set useCache to false if you want to force object the lookup of each drag and drop linked element constantly during a drag.

Set useCache to false if you want to force object the lookup of each
drag and drop linked element constantly during a...

members.doc: Iterates over all of the DragDrop elements to find ones we are hovering over or dropping on

params.doc: is this a drop op or a mouseover op?

members.name: getBestMatch
members.doc: Helper function for getting the best match from the list of drag and drop objects returned by the drag and drop events when we are in INTERSECT mode. It returns either the first object that the cursor is over, or the object that has the greatest overlap with the dragged element.

params.name: dds
params.doc: The array of drag and drop objects targeted

members.short_doc:
Helper function for getting the best match from the list of drag
and drop objects returned by the drag and drop event...

members.name: getRelated
members.doc: Returns the drag and drop instances that are in all groups the passed in instance belongs to.

params.name: p_oDD
params.doc: the obj to get related data for

members.short_doc:

members.name: getZIndex
members.doc:
Collects the z-index of the passed element, looking up the parentNode axis to find an absolutely positioned ancestor which is able to yield a z-index. If found to be not absolutely positionedm returns -1.

This is used when sorting potential drop targets into z-index order so that only the topmost receives over and drop events.

return.name: return
return.doc: The z-index of the element, or of its topmost absolutely positioned ancestor. Returns -1 if the element is not absolutely positioned.

members.short_doc:
Collects the z-index of the passed element, looking up the parentNode axis to find an absolutely positioned ancestor
...

members.name: handleMouseDown
members.doc: Fired after a registered DragDrop object gets the mousedown event. Sets up the events required to track the object being dragged
members.short_doc: Fired after a registered DragDrop object gets the mousedown event. ...

members.name: handleMouseMove
members.doc:
Internal function to handle the mousemove event. Will be invoked from the context of the html element.

TODO: figure out what we can do about mouse events lost when the user drags objects beyond the window boundary. Currently we can detect this in internet explorer by verifying that the mouse is down during the mousemove event. Firefox doesn't give us the button state on the mousemove event.
members.short_doc: Internal function to handle the mousemove event. ...

members.name: handleMouseUp
members.doc: Internal function to handle the mouseup event. Will be invoked from the context of the document.
members.short_doc: Internal function to handle the mouseup event. ...

members.doc: Called the first time an element is registered.
members.short_doc: Called the first time an element is registered. ...

members.name: isTypeOfDD
members.doc: My goal is to be able to transparently determine if an object is typeof DragDrop, and the exact subclass of DragDrop. typeof returns "object", oDD.constructor.toString() always returns "DragDrop" and not the name of the subclass. So for now it just evaluates a well-known variable in DragDrop.
members.short_doc:
My goal is to be able to transparently determine if an object is
typeof DragDrop, and the exact subclass of DragDrop. ...

members.doc: Lock all drag and drop functionality
members.short_doc: Lock all drag and drop functionality ...

members.name: preventDrag
members.doc: if a drag/drop operation is currently underway, this method stops the dragstart, drag, and dragend events from propagating down to any other listeners, e.g. scrollers
members.short_doc:
if a drag/drop operation is currently underway, this method stops the dragstart,

members.name: refreshCache
members.doc:
Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). This is in the format that is stored in the drag and drop instance, so typical usage is:

Ext.dd.DragDropManager.refreshCache(ddinstance.groups);

Alternatively:

Ext.dd.DragDropManager.refreshCache({group1:true, group2:true});

TODO: this really should be an indexed array. Alternatively this method could accept both.

params.name: groups
params.doc: an associative array of groups to refresh

members.short_doc:
Refreshes the cache of the top-left and bottom-right points of the
drag and drop objects in the specified group(s). ...

members.name: regDragDrop
members.doc: Each DragDrop instance must be registered with the DragDropManager. This is executed in DragDrop.init()

params.name: sGroup
params.doc: the name of the group this element belongs to

members.short_doc: Each DragDrop instance must be registered with the DragDropManager. ...

members.name: regHandle
members.doc: Each DragDrop handle element must be registered. This is done automatically when executing DragDrop.setHandleElId()

params.name: sDDId
params.doc: the DragDrop id this element is a handle for

params.name: sHandleId
params.doc: the id of the element that is the drag handle

members.short_doc: Each DragDrop handle element must be registered. ...

members.name: removeDDFromGroup
members.doc: Removes the supplied dd instance from the supplied group. Executed by DragDrop.removeFromGroup, so don't call this function directly.
members.short_doc: Removes the supplied dd instance from the supplied group. ...

members.name: verifyEl
members.doc: This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM. The main purpose is to handle cases where innerHTML is used to remove drag and drop objects from the DOM. IE provides an 'unspecified error' when trying to access the offsetParent of such an element
members.short_doc: This checks to make sure an element exists and is in the DOM. ...

DragDropManager is a singleton that tracks the element interaction for
all DragDrop items in the window. ...
